item1.name: A copy of Seven Days, Vermont's Alt-Weekly
item1.description:
You pick up the paper and leaf through it looking for comics
and ignoring the articles, just like everybody else does.

grid1024.name: 182 Main St.
grid1024.description:
You are standing on Main Street between Church and South Winooski.
There is a door here. A keypad sits on the handle.
On the door is a handwritten sign.

sign.read:
The sign says "Welcome to Burlington Code Academy! Come on
up to the second floor. If the door is locked, use the code
12345."
sign.take: That would be selfish. How will other students find their way?

door.open: The door is locked. There is a keypad on the door handle.
door.code: Bzzzzt! The door is still locked.

grid0924.name: 182 Main St. - Foyer
grid0924.description:
You are in a foyer. Or maybe it's an antechamber. Or a
vestibule. Or an entryway. Or an atrium. Or a narthex.
But let's forget all that fancy flatlander vocabulary,
and just call it a foyer. In Vermont, this is pronounced
"FO-ee-yurr".
A copy of Seven Days lies in a corner.

sign.read: If there was a sign here, it would say "pick up something".
sign.take: No sign here.  Maybe you want to pick up something?

door.open: You open the door and look outside.  What a lovely day!

grid0824.name: 182 Main St. - Second Floor
grid0824.description:
You are on a landing, and another staircase is ahead.
There's a door here, but it's locked.

sign.read:
You see a sign that reads "Green Mountain Semiconductor".
This is not the droid you're looking for.
sign.take: You can't take the sign!  What's with you and signs??

door.open: The door is locked, and you don't have a key.

grid0724.name: 182 Main St. - Third Floor
grid0724.description:
You're in a hallway at the top of the stairs
that extends to the west.

door.code: Um, not sure you want to do that.
